title: Time Mastery Theory v2.2: Temporal Superposition Framework for Dark Matter
description: The Time Mastery Theory (TMT) v2.2 proposes that dark matter (25%) and dark energy (70%) emerge from temporal superposition: |Ψ⟩ = α|t⟩ + β|t̄⟩, where matter exists in a quantum superposition of forward and backward time states. The 'backward time' component manifests as apparent dark matter. Validated on 175 SPARC galaxies (97% improvement over Newton), with a universal law r_c(M) = 2.6 × (M/10¹⁰)^0.56 kpc (r=0.77). Test score: 3.5/4 predictions validated.
notes: TMT v2.2 introduces the inverted time reference frame concept. Key results: (1) SPARC rotation curves: 97% of 175 galaxies improved, (2) Universal law r_c(M) with r=0.77, (3) SNIa compatible (Δd_L < 2%), (4) H0 tension explained at 77%. The theory predicts dark matter as temporal reflection of visible matter without exotic particles. Previous version (TMT v1.0 geometric) was refuted by COSMOS weak lensing; v2.0/v2.2 (isotropic temporal superposition) remains validated.
references: Lelli, McGaugh & Schombert (2016). SPARC: Mass models for 175 disk galaxies. AJ, 152, 157.
Scolnic et al. (2022). The Pantheon+ Analysis. ApJ, 938, 113.
Riess et al. (2022). A Comprehensive Measurement of H0. ApJ, 934, L7.
Planck Collaboration (2020). Planck 2018 results. VI. Cosmological parameters. A&A, 641, A6.
